name: Gaultier Divine Le Parfum
about: Fragrance Family: Florals..Scent Type: Fresh Florals..Key Notes: Calypsone (salty note), Frangipani Accord, Benzoin..Fragrance Description: Reveal your divine aura with Gaultier Divine Le Parfum, the best intense amber floral womens perfume by Jean Paul Gaultier. With a mist of this warm fall scent, spectacular lily and radiant frangipani meet with an aquatic salty kiss that embraces an airy gourmand of vanilla meringue...About the Bottle: Gaultier Divine Le Parfum honors their golden and radiant solar divinity in its iconic conical corset. Under a blazing sun, the famous corset scintillates with an unrivalled golden glow, irresistibly more intense and charismatic. The uninhibited curves and conical bust encased in flamboyant gold-ribbed metal celebrate a solar femininity with an untamed spirit...About the Fragrance: This intensely divine amber-floral fragrance invites you to be your divine and sensual self with this eau de parfum that's even more intense and daring than the original. Spectacular lily and radiant frangipani bestow their dazzling solar energy. Gaultier Divine's salty kiss embraces the warm opulence of benzoin, and the airy, gourmand indulgence of an irresistible meringue. You'll be crowned with an all-new addiction that's as seductive as it is radiant.
ingredients: Alcohol Denat., Parfum (Fragrance), Aqua (Water), Linalool, Butyl Methoxydibenzoylmethane, Limonene, Geraniol, Alpha-Isomethyl Ionone, Coumarin, Alcohol, Eugenol, Tris(Tetramethylhydroxypiperidinol) Citrate, Benzyl Benzoate, Citral, Benzyl Alcohol, Ci 19140 (Yellow 5), Ci 14700 (Red 4), Ci 42090 (Blue 1), Ci 60730 (Ext. Violet 2).
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Fragrance is intensified by the warmth of your own body. Apply in the creases of your knees and elbows for a longer-lasting, stronger scent. .-After applying, avoid rubbing or dabbing skin. This breaks down the fragrance, causing it to wear off more quickly. .-If you prefer placing fragrance on your wrists, be sure to reapply after frequent handwashing, as this tends to rinse off the scent. .-Replace fragrance after 12 months. Expired perfumes more than a year old lose the integrity of the original scent...Eau de Toilette or Eau de Parfum?: .The difference lies in the volume of perfume oil. While EDT contains five to nine percent, EDP contains more, usually eight to 14 percent. EDPs, therefore, last longer and smell more intense.
